fields.description:
On my POC setup I was logged in for a while in AWS then on Eucalyptus and I saw the following weirdness: 

1) Availability zone on my POC setup was showing up as  us-east-1a

2) In "Advanced options" in Launch instance for EBS backed instance dialog the "Add block device mapping part was not showing up"

Workaround: clear browser cache.
fields.summary: Problems with cached stuff  in AWS and Eucalyptus: pages, drop downs not showing correctly

comments.body: Note that to reproduce the dashboard availability zone selector strangeness, a zone must be selected on the dashboard in AWS, and that zone persists on the Euca side.

[~dkavanagh] Adding the cloud type ('euca' or 'aws') to the localStorage cache key at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/develop/eucaconsole/static/js/pages/dashboard.js#L12 should fix the avail zone selector issue AFAICT.

[~dkavanagh] For the BDM info not displaying, we'll need a workaround for the Advanced step, which assumes the image info is passed to the chameleon template.  Now that image selection doesn't do a page reload, we'll need to handle this some other way.  

Note that work on GUI-737 is blocked by this issue.

[~alice], [~dkavanagh], [~jloza]: Note that the block device mapping editor is missing in the launch config and launch instance wizards for EBS images due to the rework of the image selection work in GUI-586.
[~dkavanagh], [~alice], [~jloza]: Escalated this to a blocker since the block device mapping editor is now missing in the launch instance and launch config wizards.
I'm sure this is as simple as adding more info into the image_json response. Might need more translation between that and scope, but shouldn't be hard.
[~dkavanagh]: Keep in mind that the BDM editor panel (bdmapping_editor.pt) is used in the launch instance wizard, the launch config wizard, and the "Launch more like this" page.
Whoa, good catch [~kgill]! Thanks guys for finding and fixing these!
I ended up using angular to show or not show the bdm editor. We can continue to initialize from the view, or from ajax as well.

Punting back to you [~dkavanagh] to resolve two issues with https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/559

1. The "Launch more like this instance" page is displaying the block device mapping editor even for instances with non-EBS images

2. https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/559#discussion-diff-11618422R39 has two ng-show attributes
